    • Uses of Subject in org.wicketstuff.security.hive

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected Boolean SimpleCachingHive.cacheLookUp(Subject subject, Permission permission) 
      protected Boolean BasicHive.cacheLookUp(Subject subject, Permission permission)
      Allows subclasses to retrieve previously cached results and thus speed up the check.
      protected void SimpleCachingHive.cacheResult(Subject subject, Permission permission, boolean result) 
      protected void BasicHive.cacheResult(Subject subject, Permission permission, boolean result)
      Allows subclasses to cache the result of a check and thus speed up this check the next time.
      boolean Hive.hasPermission(Subject subject, Permission permission)
      Checks if the subject has the exact permission, or if the permission is implied by any of the subjects principals.
      boolean BasicHive.hasPermission(Subject subject, Permission permission) 

    • Uses of Subject in org.wicketstuff.security.hive.authentication

      Subinterfaces of Subject in org.wicketstuff.security.hive.authentication 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  WicketSubject
      In addition to Subjects, WicketSubjects play an important part in multi-login scenario's as they define what they authenticate.

      Modifier and Type Class and Description

      Default implementation of a Subject.Targeted for wicket applications.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Subject LoginContainer.getSubject()
      returns an immutable Subject which Contains all the principals of the subjects in the loginContexts.
      protected abstract Subject UsernamePasswordContext.getSubject(String username, String password)
      Validates the username and password.
      Subject UsernamePasswordContext.login()
      The username and password are always null after this method returns.
      abstract Subject LoginContext.login()
      Perform a login.
      Methods in org.wicketstuff.security.hive.authentication with parameters of type Subject

    • Uses of Subject in org.wicketstuff.security.hive.authorization

      Methods in org.wicketstuff.security.hive.authorization with parameters of type Subject 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean SimplePrincipal.implies(Subject subject)
      By default this principal does not imply any additional subjects.
      boolean Principal.implies(Subject subject)
      Even though a subject does not explicitly hold a principal, it may still be implied by the subject.
      boolean EverybodyPrincipal.implies(Subject subject)
      Always returns true.

      Subject AbstractSwarmStrategy.getSubject()
      The currently logged in subject, note that at any time there is at most 1 subject logged in.
